STATIC_heading.text: REVIEW SHEET

STATIC_text.text: Write the meaning of each combining form, prefix, or suffix in the space provided, and test yourself. Check your answers with the information in the chapter or in the Glossary (Medical Word Parts—English), at the end of the book.
Instructions: Click or tap on the plus sign to reveal the opposite side of the card.

readingPart.reading: neck (of the body or of the uterus)
lower back (side and back between the ribs and pelvis)

questionContent.questionText:
Label the regions for the abdominopelvic area.

REGIONS

  1. [Right hypochondriac region]
  2. [Left hypochondriac region]
  3. [Epigastric region]
  4. [Right lumbar region]
  5. [Left lumbar region]
  6. [Umbilical region]
  7. [Right inguinal region]
  8. [Left inguinal region]
  9. [Hypogastric region]

Label the quadrants for the abdominopelvic area

QUADRANTS

  1. [Right upper quadrant (RUQ)]
  2. [Right lower quadrant (RLQ)]
  3. [Left upper quadrant (LUQ)]
  4. [Left lower quadrant (LLQ)]

neck region (C1 to C7) [cervical]

chest region (T1 to T12) [thoracic]

lower back (loin) region (L1 to L5) [lumbar]

region of the sacrum (S1 to S5) [sacral]

tailbone region [coccygeal]

instructions.instructions: Name the divisions of the spinal column.

questionContent.questionText:
vertical plane that divides the body into anterior and posterior portions

[frontal (coronal) plane/transverse (axial) plane/sagittal (lateral) plane]

horizontal plane that divides the body into upper and lower portions

[transverse (axial) plane/frontal (coronal) plane/sagittal (lateral) plane]

vertical plane that divides the body into right and left portions

[sagittal (lateral) plane/frontal (coronal) plane/transverse (axial) plane]

instructions.instructions: Name the planes of the head as pictured below.

questionContent.questionText:
front of the body

[anterior/ventral]

back of the body

[posterior/dorsal]

away from the surface of the body

[deep]

on the surface of the body

[superficial]

far from the point of attachment to the trunk or far from the beginning of a structure

[distal]

near the point of attachment to the trunk or near the beginning of a structure

[inferior]

below another structure

[inferior]

above another structure

[superior]

pertaining to the side

[lateral]

pertaining to the middle

[medial]

lying on the belly

[prone]

lying on the back

[supine]

Chromosomes

[Rod-shaped structures in the nucleus that contain regions of DNA called genes.]

Mitochondria

[Rod-shaped structures in the cytoplasm that provide the principal source of energy for the cell.]

Nucleus

[Control center of the cell.]

DNA

[Chemical found within each chromosome]

Endoplasmic reticulum

[Network of canals within the cytoplasm of the cell.]

Cell membrane

[Structure surrounding and protecting the cell.]

Catabolism

[Process of breaking down complex nutrients into simpler substances.]

Anabolism

[Process of building up large proteins from amino acids.]

Metabolism

[Total of the chemical process in a cell.]

instructions.instructions: Select the correct meanings of the terms pertaining to the cell.

questionContent.questionText:
membrane surrounding the lungs

[pleura]

membrane surrounding the abdominal viscera

[peritoneum]

muscular wall separating the thoracic and abdominal cavities

[diaphragm]

space between the lungs, containing the heart, windpipe, aorta

[thoracic cavity]

backbone

[vertebra]

pad of cartilage between each backbone and the next

[disc]

instructions.instructions: Give the term from the meanings below.
